Description: Sheet with twelve images after Rembrandt printed from the same plate, from top left to bottom right: the rest on the flight into Egypt; the flight into Egypt; a self-portrait of Rembrandt; a peasant standing, wearing a large cloak (not after Rembrandt); two peasants standing, directed to right; Death presenting an hourglass to a fashionable couple; self-portrait of Rembrandt, in an oval; a physician with a hat, standing half-length directed to right, holding the Virgin's hand and feeling her pulse, after Willem Drost who copied after Rembrandt; 'Het stiertje', a bull standing on a river-bank, tied to a fence; and three very small scenes showing peasants. c.1859 Etching and drypoint, printed on thin paper
Curator's comments: The scenes were cut and used as illustrations to Charles Blanc's 'L'Oeuvre complet de Rembrandt' (Paris: Gide,1859-61). For another impression and comment see 1866,1013.565.
Bibliographic references: New Hollstein (Dutch & Flemish) / The New Hollstein: Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts 1450-1700 (259) (Rembrandt; copy undescribed)

IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (56)
Hind 1923 / A Catalogue of Rembrandt's Etchings; chronologically arranged and completely illustrated (307) (Rejected as Rembrandt; copy undescribed)
White & Boon 1969 / Rembrandt's Etchings: An Illustrated Critical Catalogue (59) (copy described)
